etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Mona's Herald. From Manx jough, cognate with Irish deoch drink (Early Irish deog, deoch), apparently from the same Celtic base as Welsh diod drink, beer; the Celtic base is probably ultimately derived from a verbal base with the sense ‘to drink’, further etymology unknown

definitions: Alcoholic drink; especially light ale. Now chiefly in "jough y nollick": a warm spiced ale drunk at Christmas.
